content.description: Angulation wall.  Climb up onto the ledge running the length of the wall, climb the right angling crack, then straight up past two (2) bolts and trad gear.  Climb the scalloped face towards a bulge (lots of balance moves), pull over the bulge and top out.  A set of rap bolts were added on top of this route somewhere around Memorial Day 2011.
Start below the obvious off-width crack, climb up onto the ledge running the length of the wall, climb / jam the crack up to an outward sloping covey, continue on up to the top.
content.protection:
Trad 

  Bring some big stuff, it will be greatly appreciated halfway up, #5 and #6 Camalots would be awesome, and if you like passive pro better bring some #10 and #11 hexes.

content.description: Start about ten (10) feet from the left side of the wall, climb up onto the ledge running the length of the wall, go straight up through two (2) bolts.  Continue up and left to holes for slings.  Top out onto a small rounded ledge, climb on up to the top.
content.protection: Mixed, with 2 bolts down low and finger to small hands gear up high. But watch out for hollow under cling flakes. No fixed anchor as of April 20, 2019, but walk off left, or traverse right and down climb to rap from fixed anchor on top of Surf the Boogie.

content.description: This crag is located left of Jims Wall.  It is a great near vertical wall offering different situations ranging from face climbing to crack jamming.  Its overall height is approximately forty-five (45) vertical feet.  The rock itself is very different form the rest.  It is very gritty.  In some places it seams as if you were cheating it is that gritty.
